headline.main: Algerian, Born Of Rape, Gets French Pension

lead_paragraph: A man conceived in a rape by French soldiers during the Algerian independence war was declared a war victim today and awarded damages. An appeals court awarded Muhammad Garne, 41, a partial military pension for three years, but denied his request for full lifetime benefits.
abstract: Appeals court in Paris, France, says man conceived in rape by French soldier during Algerian independence war is war victim entitled to damages; court awards Muhammad Garne partial military pension for three years; Garne's mother, who was 16 when she was raped, gave him up when he was born and he was raised in orphanages in Algeria; this is first time French court has ruled that person conceived as result of rape is war victim (M)
